generif.text: This nuclear protein with signature motifs of FHA and BRCT, and an internal 41-amino acid repeat sequence, is an early participant in DNA damage response.
role in DNA damage signaling pathways
NFBD1 is parallel to 53BP1 in regulating Chk2 and downstream of H2AX in the recruitment of repair and signaling proteins to sites of DNA damage in tumor cells
MDC1-mediated focus formation by the MRE11 complex at sites of DNA damage is crucial for the efficient activation of the intra-S-phase checkpoint
MDC1 is recruited through its FHA domain to the activated CHK2 and has a critical role in CHK2-mediated DNA damage responses
role for MDC1 in mediating transduction of the DNA damage signal
MDC1 regulates BRCA1 function in DNA damage checkpoint control
NFBD1 has a role in DNA checkpoint signaling and recruits repair proteins to the sites of DNA damage.

MDC1 acts not only as a mediator of DNA damage checkpoint but also as a mediator of DNA damage repair

MDC1 is phosphorylated on a cluster of conserved repeat motifs by casein kinase 2 and this phosphorylation promotes direct, phosphorylation-dependent interactions with NBS1.
MDC1 and BRIT1 may function as tumor-suppressor genes, at least in part by orchestrating proper centrosome duplication and mitotic spindle assembly.

Nbs1 has a function in ATR signalling in a manner distinct to any role at stalled replication forks. Replication-independent ATR signalling also requires the mediator proteins, 53BP1 and MDC1, providing direct evidence for their role in ATR signalling.

knockdown of MCM2 or MCM6 could significantly inhibit foci forming of MDC1 in TE-1 nuclei in response to bleomycin-induced DNA damage (p < 0.001). This study indicates the direct interaction between MDC1 and MCMs in TE-1 nuclei.

NFBD1 protein is overexpressed in NPC tissues and that silencing NFBD1 can inhibit cell growth, induce apoptosis, increase the production of intracellular ROS. NFBD1 knockdown also inhibits the tumorigenicity of NPC cells in vivo.

Thus, we reveal an important, hitherto-unnoticed cooperation between MDC1 and TOPBP1 in maintaining genome stability during cell division

wikipathways.name: ATM Signaling Network in Development and Disease

summary: The protein encoded by this gene contains an N-terminal forkhead domain, two BRCA1 C-terminal (BRCT) motifs and a central domain with 13 repetitions of an approximately 41-amino acid sequence. The encoded protein is required to activate the intra-S phase and G2/M phase cell cycle checkpoints in response to DNA damage. This nuclear protein interacts with phosphorylated histone H2AX near sites of DNA double-strand breaks through its BRCT motifs, and facilitates recruitment of the ATM kinase and meiotic recombination 11 protein complex to DNA damage foci. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
